CatDescriptText: Mr. Jack Butler, 2714 Wylie Avenue, Fifth Ward was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 26, 1957, pg. 1, with question: "Do you believe we should have a state law forbidding strikes of trolley cars, buses, and taxicabs?" answer reads: "Workers in those classes like others should be free to strike. There should not be a state law.  The rising cost of living affects them as much as everybody else.  Therefore, the right-to-strike should be used to obtain a cost-of-living salary, if necessary."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Jack Butler wearing moustache, dark hat, and plaid jacket, standing in front of brick wall with railing
